main event: A bright, unidentified object was detected on radar and observed visually for about 3 minutes over Derry, Massachusetts on April 6, 1961.
interesting points: The object was first detected on ground radar at 0521 EDT.
The object appeared to be circular with visible light, very large, and flew silently and level at high speed.
The object seemed to disperse into smaller objects before fading from sight.
The case is described as an interesting, well-documented UFO sighting involving both radar confirmation and visual observation.
The behavior of the object is characterized as that of a real physical object.
sighted object: a large, circular object with visible light
witnesses: ground radar operators and visual observers
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
